Details on Inital Metadata Components

Inital-Metadata-Information.Rmd

The following libraries are needed to create a working EML document.

library(EDIutils)
library(tidyverse)
library(readxl)
library(EML)

Custom inputs to the initial metadata information

This document gives more in depth examples on how to use the add_access, add_pub_date, add_keywords, and add_license elements.

Access Permissions

Default Permissions

The add_access adds an access section at the beginning of our EML document. The add_access default is public principal with a read permission.

access <- add_access()

Custom Permissions

If you would like to change the principle and permissions for access please specify a valid principle and permission. The valid options for principal are:

  • ‘public’ - special principal indicate that any user or group has a particular access permission
  • other individual users or groups can be specified if they are defined in the PASTA EDI authentication system. Read the PASTA documentation for more information

The valid options for permission are:

  • ‘read’ - allow viewing of the resource,
  • ‘write’ - allow modification of the resource (except for access rules),
  • ‘changePermission’ - modifications including access rules, and
  • ‘all’ - all of the above.

The example below shows the add_access function taking in a public principle with a permission of all.

access <- add_access(allow_principal = "public", allow_permission = "all")

Publication Date

Default Publication Date

The publication date does not have a tab in the excel sheet, but is simply added with the add_pub_date function. If no date is provided, it will automatically append the current date. This can be overwritten by providing an input for date.

publication_date <- add_pub_date(list())

Custom Publication Date

If you wish to provide an input for date please do so using a date in international date format (ISO). A date in ISO format lists year, month and day as follows: “YYYY-MM-DD”. The example below uses add_pub_date to add a custom date.

publication_date <- add_pub_date(list(), date = "2020-08-19")

Keyword Set

Keywords that do not come from a controlled vocabulary

The next item we will append is the keyword set. We can use the add_keyword_set function to do so. The keyword set should include a list of words that help identify your project or connect it with other similar projects. This information can be added to the “keyword_set” tab in the excel file “example-metadata.xlsx”.

keyword_set <- metadata$keyword_set
keywords <- add_keyword_set(list(), keyword_set[,1])

Keywords from a controlled vocabulary

If you add keywords from a controlled vocabulary you must state what keyword thesaurus they belong to. Multiple keyword sets can be provided. This information can be added to the “keyword_set” tab in the excel file “example-metadata.xlsx”.

unique_thesaurus <- unique(metadata$keyword_set$keywordThesaurus)
keywords <- list()
add_keywords = function(unique_thesaurus){
  keywords <- add_keyword_set(keywords, 
                              keyword_set = list(keyword = metadata$keyword_set$keyword[keyword_set$keywordThesaurus == unique_thesaurus],
                                                 keywordThesaurus = unique_thesaurus))
}
all_keywords <- purrr::map(unique_thesaurus, add_keywords) %>% flatten()

License and Intellectual Rights

Default Licenses

The add_license function allows you to append the licensing and usage information to your file. Both the CC0 and CCBY licenses can be chosen as defaults using this function, and the rest of the information will be appended for you. This information can be added to the “license” tab in the excel file “example-metadata.xlsx”.

license <- add_license(list(), 
                       default_license = metadata$license$default_license)

Custom Licenses

If a default license is not being used, then the other inputs need to be provided in the “license” tab in the excel file “example-metadata.xlsx”.

license <- add_license(list(),
                       license_name = metadata$license$license_name,
                       license_url = metadata$license$license_url,
                       license_identifier = metadata$license$license_identifier,
                       intellectual_rights_description = metadata$license$intellectual_rights_description)
